row.entry:
Low light module allows to simulate human lowlight vision, thus providing ability to make lowlight pictures look closer to reality. It can also be used to perform a day to night conversion.
The idea is to calculate a scotopic vision image which is perceived by rods rather than than cones in the eye under low light. Scotopic lightness then is mixed with photopic value (regular color image pixel) using some blending function. Also this module is able to simulate the Purkinje effect by adding some blueness to the dark parts of the image.

sect4.title: Usage
sect4.para: This module comes with several presets. Give them a try to get a better feeling how it works.

sect5.title: curve
sect5.para: The horizontal axis is about pixel lightness from dark (left) to bright (right). The vertical axis represents the kind of vision from night vision (bottom) to day vision (top)

sect5.title: blue
sect5.para: Set the blue hint in shadows (Purkinje effect).
